Assertions.description: Check that the current element, a checkbox is checked or not
From the current element, apply the xpath and check to see if any of the  children have the text ...
Check that the current element has the specified attribute and value
Check that the current element has the specified attributes
Check that the current element contains the specified text
Check that the current element has the expected text value
Asserts that an element (identified by ID) eventually gets some specific  text inserted into it (by JavaScript, probably)
Assert that the specified text is not found within the page
Check that the page title is ....
Check that the current element, a radio button, is checked or not
Check that any of the html tags have the specified attribute name and  value
Check that any of the html tags have the specified text
Check that the element with id has the text ....

Clicks.description: Click a button that has the text...
Find an element by id, then click it.
Click the link "(....)" as it appears on the page
Performs a context click (typically right click, unless this has been  changed by the user) on the current element.
Performs a double click on the current element (set with a previous Find  method).
Submit the form of the current element. NB using click is preferable as  javascript may be executed on click, which this method would bypass

Forms.description: Asserts a value of a radio button
Select a value in the option list in the current element, a Find  operation is required immediatebly before
Select a value in the option list that has the id
Clear any text from the element, and enter text (to the current element)
Find an element by id, clear any text from the element, and enter text
Enters text to the current element, without clearing any current content  first
Sets a check box value; deprecated use
Sets the value of the current element, assumed to be a checkbox to...
Sets the value of the current element, assumed to be a radio button to...

Use: FindRadioButton inside tag="label" with label="<radio_button_text>"  + SetRadioButton checked=<true> in preference as this will locate the  radio button by visible text rather than the underlying value.    Locates a radio button with a specific value and checks the radio button.
Sets the value of a radio button

Location.description: Find an element by it's ID
Find an element by it's ID with the specified timeout
Find an element using the name attribute of the element
Find an element by tag name and a set of attributes and corresponding  values

Location.example: FindCheckbox inside tag="label" with label="a checkbox label>"
Location.description: Finds a checkbox that is a child of the specified tag, that contains the specified text; eg.
Finds an element that is a child of the current element using the name  attribute, another Find method should be used first
Finds an element that is a child of the current element using the tag  name and specified attributes, another Find method should be used first

Location.example: FindRadioButton inside tag="label" with label="a radio label>"
Location.description: Finds a radiobutton that is a child of the specified tag, that contains the specified text; eg.
Finds an element on the page with the specified tag and text

Location.example:
NavigateTo /myApp (will navigate to http://localhost/myApp if
          base.url is set to http://localhost)
Location.description: Navigate to a url, if the url begins with http or file, the url will be  used as is, if a relative url is specified then it will be prepended with  the base url property
Transfer the focus into the current element (set with a previous Find  method) which should be a frame or iframe
Wait for the specified number of milliseconds
Wait for the page title to change to the specified value

Miscellaneous.description: Compare the text of an element (identified by ID) to a value previously  remembered
Asserts that an element (identified by ID) eventually gets some text  inserted into it (by JavaScript, probably)
Simple text search on page source
Compare the text of an element (identified by ID) to a value previously  remembered - assert they're the same

Miscellaneous.expression: AssertSelect id="<id>" text="<value>" is currently selected
AssertSelect id="<id>" text="<value>" is not currently selected

Miscellaneous.description: Grab the text of an element (identified by id) and save it for the  duration of this scenario

Startup / Shutodwn.description: Shuts down the current web driver session
Starts a new web driver session

Table.example: AssertTableValue column 2, row 3 contains text "Hello Bob"
Table.description: Check that a table cell contains the specified text using a 1 based  index. Row 0 is the first  <tr>  beneath a <tbody>
Find an element within a table row by tag and attributes.
Find a link (anchor) element within a table row using the link text as a  discriminator.
Locates the table body row, assuming that the table has already been  located Row 1 is the first  <tr>  beneath a <tbody>

Find a row in a table where columns exist that contain the specified  text. Not all columns of the table need to specified, however the order  is important. Finding multiple matching results will result in an error.    Once the row has been located, other FindInRow methods can be used that  may in turn refer to and set the 'Current Element', this method does not  set the current element for that reason.
